triples.evidence: The hue represents the main direction of the diffusion and the brightness the fractional anisotropy.
MRI can provide functional information, such as how water and blood move inside tissues.
Using diffusion-weighted and diffusion-tensor imaging, we can track how water molecules travel along nerve fibers, revealing the brain’s communication pathways.
triples.o: how water molecules travel along nerve fibers

evidence: Figure 4.31 Color coded fractional anisotropy (FA) map. The hue represents the main direction of the diffusion and the brightness the fractional anisotropy.
